result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Teresa A Keppert in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. On motion of the State, Court orders case dismissed and readin.

Attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz in court.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not appearing in court.  Counsel advises the court of the defendants situation.  Counsel requests adjournment for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant called and spoke with clerk in regards to today's hearing, she will be unable to attend due to a family situation.

Defendant Teresa A Keppert in court with Attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody of the Ozaukee County Jail. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel requests cash bail be set. State has no objections. Court sets cash bail to cover all files with conditions. 
Matter adjourned to April 13, 2016 at 10:00 a.m. for plea and sentencing.

Defendant Teresa A Keppert in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of complaint/penalties thereof. Defendant enters not guilty plea on 16CM78. Atty. Alme Boaz states defendant cannot comply with bail conditions, requests bail be revoked. Court revokes bail, remands defendant to custody of the Sheriff's Dept.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.
